notesStmt.note: Shem Ṭov ben Shelomoh Zaḳun: inscribed, folio 1r.Records of circumcision of Avraham ben Mosheh Bolleli (?), dated 5556 (1796), and Shabtai ben Yehoshu῾a Musṭaḳi (?), dated 5557 (1797): inscribed, folio 56v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A festival prayer book with services for Rosh ha-Shanah and Yom Kipur, according to the Corfu rite.

collation.p: Irregular quiring, foldings from 4 to 11 leaves each.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi (Greek?) square script, punctuated, of the 18th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Services for New Year and Day of Atonement. Corfu Rite. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Or. 5013.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Joseph Schlesinger: purchased from him on 13 May 1896: inscribed, folio [58v].
